messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] OT: Re: Unassisted Home Birth  (WAS: Arm's Reach Mini...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/16/2006 11:34:43 P.M. Eastern Standard Time, wuweimama@earthlink.net writes: Many unnecessary C-sections occur and the incidence
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/16/2006 11:34:43 P.M. Eastern Standard Time,
wuweimama@... writes:

Many unnecessary
C-sections occur and the incidence (epidemic proportions) is
unbelievable. Please see many, many, many documents disclosing these
issues on Mothering.com. The number of "emergency" c-sections compared
to similar socio-economic and matched risk groups varies by
practioner, state and country. Midwives, save women and babies from
c-sections according to these same research criteria.



Great books to read on this subject are OBSTETRIC MYTHS VS. RESEARCH
REALITIES, and THE THINKING WOMAN'S GUIDE TO A BETTER BIRTH, both written by Henci
Goer. And yes, the thread isn't about unschooling however I must say that had
I never discovered the free thinking way to give birth I would have never
ventured down this education road with the children. One thing really led to
another, at least in our lives.

Adriana




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
